question: Carl has a vegetable stand at the community market. He sells three kinds of vegetables: lilies, sunflowers and tulips. He usually sells lilies for €2.557142857142857 per basket, sunflowers for €4.526923076923078 per basket and tulips for €5.186 per basket. Carl has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Carl sells 21 baskets of lilies, 25 baskets of sunflowers and 35 baskets of tulips, how much will he make?
answer:
Carl will round his lilies up from €2.557142857142857 to €3, since the number following the 2 is 5 or higher.
Carl will round his sunflowers up from €4.526923076923078 to €5, since the number following the 4 is 5 or higher.
Carl will round his tulips down from €5.186 to €5, since the number following the 5 is less than 5.
Carl sells 21 lilies*€3 = €<<21*3=63>>63
Carl sells 25 sunflowers*€5 = €<<25*5=125>>125
Carl sells 35 tulips*€5 = €<<35*5=175>>175
Altogether, Carl will make €63 + €125 + €175 = €<<63+125+175=363>>363
#### 363
